description: A calque of German Kommunismus (from the Manifest der Kommunistischen Partei (“Manifesto of the Communist Party”) by Marx and Engels, published in 1848), in turn a calque of French communisme, which was formed from commun (“common”) (from Latin commūnis) and the suffix -isme (“-ism”).

entries.meaning: Any far-left political ideology or philosophy advocating holding the production of resources collectively, especially by seizing it through revolution.
Any political social system that implements a communist political philosophy.
The international socialist society where classes, money, and the state no longer exist.
